structure.unit: ARTICLE LXIII. MIAMI-DADE COUNTY BLACK AFFAIRS ADVISORY BOARD

text.section:
Sec. 2-835. Supervision and Support.
The Office of the Chairperson of the County Commission, County Attorney and Clerk of the Board shall provide appropriate support for the Black Affairs Advisory Board. The Chairperson of the County Commission shall have the power to appoint, employ, remove and supervise such assistants, employees, and personnel as deemed necessary to provide appropriate support to the Black Affairs Advisory Board, and such assistants, employees, and personnel shall serve at the will of the Chairperson of the County Commission.
